section.name: Before you start...
section.p: Before you start, make sure you've satisfied all requirements.

section.name: Running NutchWAX
section.p: Download a NutchWAX binary. See sourceforge downloads page. Ungzip and untar. Let the unpacked directory be ${NUTCHWAX} in all that follows (For how to build from source, see Building from src page).

subsection.name: Indexing and searching a small collection - Using NutchWAX 0.4.2 or earlier (i.e pre-mapreduce NutchWAX)
subsection.p: Try out NutchWAX on a small collection of ARCs first. % cd ${NUTCHWAX} % chmod u+x ./bin/* % ./bin/indexarcs.sh -h indexarcs.sh is a wrapper script that will run through all the indexing step. It takes a bunch of options. To do the most basic indexing operation, point it a few ARC files and let it run: % ./bin/indexarcs.sh -s ${HOME}/arcs/ -d ${HOME}/nutch-data -c COLLECTION_NAME This will build an index for you in ${HOME}/nutch-data (-n says do not run the deduplication step -- necessary if you are using nutchwax with WERA -- and the '-c' is the name of the collection the indexed content will belong to).

To search this index, copy the ${NUTCHWAX}/webapps/nutchwax.war file under the ${TOMCAT}/webapps directory. Then start tomcat FROM ${HOME}/nutch-data, the directory you built the index in (Nutch by default will use the current working directory of the tomcat container when looking for the index to open). Browse to the '/nutchwax' context on your tomcat instance and try searches against the ARC content.
To learn more about the indexing and searching process, see operation and the FAQ.

subsection.name: wera
subsection.p: You'll notice that clicking on a NutchWAX search result takes you nowhere. This is because NutchWAX by default has no means of rendoring the search hit out of the web archive collection. WERA is an application that can do this for you. WERA is like the Internet Archive Wayback Machine except it also supports full text search (courtesy of NutchWAX). It is a php application for searching and browsing WACs. See the WERA for how to install.
